moves.1. d4 d5 2. c4 c6: ...normally i would go in for a Benko but sure why not try something else..
moves.10. Bd3 e6 11. a3 Nb6 12. Be3 Be7 13. Qc: ..white and black are developing quickly...i see a chance to disrupt Whites K side..with a probabale 0-0-0 following for white...
moves.13... Bg5 14. O-O-O Bxe3+ 15. fxe3 Qe7 1: ...interesting position now. White has an attack with the Q to a7 but black has mobility and dual threats to g2 and e3
